revised_title: Extinct Mammals of Madagascar: Megaladapis Insignis
tldr: The author describes the discovery of a new species of Megaladapis, M. insignis, from fossil remains found in Madagascar. The main interest in these remains lies in the nearly perfect condition of the teeth, which reveal a gigantic form of Lemuroid. The author compares the teeth's pattern with those of Megaladapis madagascariensis and other related species, providing a detailed description of the teeth's features and differences.
